required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Oral Functions and Malocclusions: a Comprehensive Epidemiological Study on 358 Schoolchildren in France

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of our research is to establish a link between malocclusions and oral dysfunctions. The clinical examination includes: caries screening (DMFT and dft scores), a quantification of dental plaque (Silness and Loë's plaque index) and orthodontic treatment need (Haute Autorité de Santé HAS). The functional examination includes improper mouth breathing, abnormal deglutition and incorrect position of tongue at rest.

primary_outcome.description: Dental malocclusion as defined by the HAS: - An extraoral examination: sub-nasal profile, the sub-nasal angle and the labial-mental groove;
Dental malocclusion as defined by the HAS: - An intraoral examination: right and left molar dental class (Angle classification, overjet (abnormal when> 3mm)
Dental malocclusion as defined by the HAS: , number of patient with shifted midlines ,
Dental malocclusion as defined by the HAS: number of patient with an overbite (overbite> 2mm)
Dental malocclusion as defined by the HAS: number of patient with an open bite (overbite <0)

secondary_outcome.description: The functional pral examination includes improper mouth breathing: type of ventilation -1: Number of patient with adenoid facies
The functional examination includes improper mouth breathing: type of ventilation - 2 Number of patient with a positive Glaze's test
The functional examination includes improper mouth breathing: type of ventilation - 3 Number of patient with a positive Rosenthal's test
The functional examination includes abnormal deglutition. Number of patient with an abnormal déglutition (clinical exam)

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional oral examination - position of tongue
secondary_outcome.description: The functional examination includes i incorrect position of tongue at rest. number of patient with en incorrect position of the tongue (clinical exam)

Index of the severity of the caries disease (DMFT and dft); Silness and Loë's plaque index (0: absence of plaque, 1: plaque not visible to the naked eye but detachable with the probe; 2: plaque visible to the naked eye; 3: abundant plaque visible to the naked eye in the sulcus and on the marginal gingiva)

study_pop.textblock: Comprehensive study involving all six-grade schoolchildren in Cagnes sur mer, Alpes Maritimes, France

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All the pupils benefit from the clinical examination
Exclusion Criteria:
- NONE
